representative James Lankford of
Oklahoma one of 87 new Republican
members of the House there's still the

first and foremost how to get around a

buildings rotunda in order to appear on

mr. Lankford was still learning that
routine on Wednesday morning September
2008 had a real sense of real sense of
calling the new congressman navigated
his first week without admitting to many
jitters he leaned on his Christian faith
before running for Congress he was
director of a large Christian youth camp
but he felt a new calling and after what
he called a prayer journey he decided to
run largely on his credentials as a
Washington outsider but the reality is
we're supposed to be here and we have a
job to do job number one really for me
is pulling back our spending yet as he
roamed the halls of the Capitol to pick

an example was when he ran into John
Dingell in an elevator
the Michigan Democrat has been in

just meet him introduce myself it was
great to meet him and it is been a very

mind I'm being sworn in today someone is
watching it on the news tonight and
thinking I'm gonna run against him two
years from now it was a similar dynamic
all around Capitol Hill a feeling of
euphoria at the change brought to
Washington tempered by the reality of
divided government and being near the

his family returns to Oklahoma mr.
Lankford will be sleeping on his office
couch during the week to save money the

with an unsettled political climate and

sleeping on his dirt in Afghanistan
he'll take a couch in the congressional

the rancorous tone so far but he also
embraced the fight ahead there are gonna
be things we're gonna disagree on but
there's a difference between disagreeing
on policy and just disagreeing to be a
